oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Feliks before the Fall. A Biographical Approach to Understanding Stalinism
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lauchlan, Ian
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This article explores the use of biography as a means of explaining the rise of Stalin. As a case study it focuses on the early life of Feliks Dzerzhinskii, founder of the Cheka, a man who seemed to embody the ambivalent nature of the transition from Leninism to Stalinism. This piece highlights the formative experiences of a figure many saw as the ideal Bolshevik and the way in which these experiences shaped the Stalinist regime.University of Edinburgh
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: The International Newsletter of Communist Studies; Vol. 19 No. 26 (2013); 48-61
